TQDR, TQDR General
70.1 TQDR General
� General information:
The Aggregate TQDR ful?ls the following tasks:
? Calculation of Actuator setpoints for the desired engine torque (reverse torque model)
? Calculation of the actual engine torque from actual engine operating parameters(forward path of the
torque model)
? Calculation of the current engine torque capabilities (Minimum and Maximum torque)
The aggregate is available in 3 variants:
? Variant 1 : HPDI System with strati?ed mode
? Variant 2 : MPI Systems
? Variant 3 : HPDI System without strati?ed mode
� Architecture Overview:
Variant 1:
Variant 2 and 3:

TQDR, TQDR General
� Functional Overview:
70.1.1 (TQM) Setpoint ignition angle
In homogeneous combustion mode (LV_HOM_RUN = 1), this module delivers the output IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ. The
output IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ represents the ignition retard with reference to IGA_REF_COR that is necessary to
generate the indicated engine
torque TQI_SP. IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ is a function of the ignition angle ef?ciency setpoint EFF_IGA_SP, which, in turn,
is calculated out of the Reference Indicated Torque TQI_REF and the actual ef?ciencies EFF_SCC_AV, EFF_EGR_
HOM, EFF_TQI_COR_CUS, and EFF_LAMB_AV.
70.1.2 Full load enrichment
In order to maximize the torque output of the engine at higher loads, it is possible to operate the engine with
a richer fuel/air mixture. If full load conditions are detected (i.e. LV_FL=1), LAMB_FL will directly impact the
lambda setpoint in the module ?Lambda coordination?.
70.1.3 Reference and Basic Torque
This module delivers the reference indicated engine torque TQI_REF, basic indicated engine torque TQI_BAS
and other basic torque values for the torque model in homogeneous combustion mode.
70.1.4 Torque based pattern calculation
The objective of this module is to generate a torque intervention by fuel cut-off pattern.
This torque intervention could be caused by several conditions which are summarized in the label LV_AUTH_
TQ_PAT. The label LV_FCUT_FAST can be used for project speci?c fast fuel cut-off conditions.

TQDR, TQDR General
70.1.5 SCC Basic and actual ef?ciency
EFF_SCC_BAS is the basic ef?ciency for single cylinder fuel cut-off and is utilized during permanent fuel cut-
off interventions (e.g. cylinder bank speci?c fuel cut-off). With an external request from "Basic fuel cut-off
coordination", a requested basic ef?ciency is applied. A calibrateable constant can be set for the basic ef?ciency,
if enabled.
EFF_SCC_AV is the ef?ciency that represents the actual impact of fuel cut-off interventions on the indicated
engine torque.
Every fuel cut-off intervention deriving from
- pattern (engine speed limitation, ASR, GS, etc.)
- trailing throttle fuel cut-off
- mis?re
- engine stop
is considered.
The calculation of this parameter can be performed in two alternative ways (by means of LC_EFF_SCC_AV_
MOD_SEL).
70.1.6 Basic fuel cut-off coordination
For certain modes of fuel injection deactivation it might be necessary to have a correspond-ing basic ef?ciency
for fuel cut-off (e.g. cylinder bank deactivation). There can also be more than one mode with a certain ef?ciency,
so this needs to be coordinated.
This module can be adapted to project speci?c needs for calculation of EFF_SCC_BAS. With the logical variable
LV_EFF_BAS_REQ the value EFF_SCC_BAS is obtained from EFF_SCC_BAS_REQ.
70.1.7 Initialization module
In this module, all output interfaces of the Aggregate TQDR are initialized that are not covered by a functional-
ity.
70.1.8 Maximum torque at clutch
TQ_MAX_CLU is the maximum effective torque which can be requested from driver or cruise control. If the
torque is not limited by other functions (see below), the value is determined from the map IP_TQI_REF and
TQ_LOSS_REQ_CLU. The map IP_TQI_REF is de?ned in the module ?Reference and Basic Torque?. Note that the
original breakpoint MAF is replaced by the breakpoint MAF_MAX_COR!
70.1.9 Minimum torque at clutch
TQ_MIN_CLU is the minimum torque at clutch which can be requested from driver and cruise control.
70.1.10 Actual engine torque
TQI_AV is the actual indicated engine torque produced either in homogeneous or strati?ed combustion mode.
The combustion mode is indicated by the logical variable LV_S_ACT (1 ... strati?ed combustion; 0 ... homoge-
neous combustion). TQ_AV is the actual static effective torque at clutch. TQE is the actual effective torque at
clutch inclusive inertia.
70.1.11 Minimum indicated engine torque at trailing throttle
In case of homogeneous combustion, TQI_MIN_PU is the minimum limitation for TQI_SP_MAF at trailing throttle
condition to ensure either a safe combustion process at low load conditions or a feasible manifold absolute
pressure during fuel cut-off. It is formed by a basic limitation TQI_MIN_PU_1, an AMP correction offset TQI_MIN_
PU_OFS_AMP, and, during trailing throttle fuel cut-off, by an additional offset TQI_ADD_PUC.
The parameter LV_TQI_BOL_SET indicates that a minimum indicated engine torque has been reached. The
test for this condition can be performed in three different modes. LV_TQI_BOL_SET is utilized to trigger state
transitions in the Aggregate Engine Operating States (ENOS).

TQDR, TQDR General
70.1.12 Torque based MAF setpoint for homogeneous mode
The output parameter MAF_SP_TQI represents the mass air ?ow setpoint for the homoge-neous combustion
mode. It is utilized as an input parameter for the reverse Intake Manifold Model, where it is translated into a
setpoint for the opening angle of the throttle blade. MAF_SP_TQI is obtained from the map IP_MAF_SP (inverse
map of IP_TQI_REF) as a function of engine speed N_32 and the corrected torque setpoint TQI_SP_MAF.
70.1.13 Ignition angle ef?ciency
The ignition angle ef?ciencies EFF_IGA_AV, EFF_IGA_BAS_COR, and EFF_IGA_BAS_COR_KNK_FIL are calculated
in this module.
70.1.14 Basic, actual and minimum Lambda ef?ciency
This module delivers torque ef?ciencies EFF_LAMB_xxx depending on the difference of the input lambda
value (LAMB_BAS_COR_MV, LAMB_SP_MV, LAMB_BAS_COR_MAX and LAMB_SP_BAS_MV) to corrected refer-
ence lambda LAMB_REF_COR.
70.1.15 Reference and basic torque for strati?ed mode
TQI_REF_S is the reference torque, i.e. the indicated torque obtained when the optimal engine parameters are
applied (ignition, EGR rate, injection phase).
70.1.16 Actual engine torque for strati?ed
TQI_AV_S is the actual indicated engine torque produced in strati?ed combustion mode. If the logical variable
LV_S_CLC = 1 then the strati?ed combustion mode will be calculated.
70.1.17 Torque based fuel mass setpoint for strati?ed mode
TQI_SP_FAST_S is the indicated engine torque setpoint for the strati?ed combustion mode. Since the torque
generation in strati?ed mode is fuel-mass controlled, this torque setpoint will be realized through an adjustment
of the injected fuel mass. All other actuators (e.g. EGR, MAF, IGA, PORT) will be set to their optimized setpoints
for this operating point. If actuator values deviate from its setpoints (e.g. during transients), the fuel mass
has to be adjusted accordingly to compensate for these effects. This compensation is done by means of the
total ef?ciency for the strati?ed mode EFF_TOT_AV_S. In the case that the evaporative emission control system
purges fuel vapor into the Intake Manifold, its torque contribution TQI_ADD_CP will be taken into account as a
corrective term. After the corrections are performed, the torque parameter TQI_SP_MFF_FAST will be obtained.
This parameter will then be used as input for the map IP_MFF_SP_S[i]. The output MFF_SP_FAST_S_ENG[i] will
be utilized as basic value for the calculation of the injection time for the cylinder bank i. The de?nition of the
cylinder banks is based on the con?guration of the intake system.
70.1.18 EGR ef?ciency
The function is intended for HPDI systems that are operated in homogeneous and in strati?ed combustion
mode. Here, signi?cant deviations of EGR_RATIO from its optimal value can be observed during transitions
between the combustion modes. The impact of these deviations is twofold: Firstly, the pumping losses of the
engine are decreased or increased since the total mass ?ow MAF_CYL_STK is changed. Secondly, the indicated
ef?ciency in the high-pressure loop is changed due to the EGR impact on heat release and wall heat losses.
The ef?ciencies EFF_EGR_HOM and EFF_EGR_S were introduced to compensate for the effects in the high-
pressure loop.
70.1.19 MAF ef?ciency for strati?ed
This function is intended for HPDI systems that are operated in both homogeneous and strati?ed combustion
mode.

The ef?ciencies EFF_EGR_HOM and EFF_EGR_S were introduced to compensate for the effects in the high-
pressure loop.
70.1.19 MAF ef?ciency for strati?ed
This function is intended for HPDI systems that are operated in both homogeneous and strati?ed combustion
mode. During the transition between the two combustion modes, signi?cant deviations of the mass air ?ow
value from its original setpoint can be observed. The impact of this deviation on the indicated engine torque
is compensated by means of EFF_MAF_S.

TQDR, TQDR General
70.1.20 Minimum indicated engine torque at trailing throttle for strati?ed
The function is intended for HPDI systems. Depending on the settings in the Combustion State Manager, the
engine might remain in the strati?ed combustion mode during PU. In this case, the indicated torque will be
limited to TQI_MIN_PU_S.
70.1.21 Torque based lambda setpoint calculation
This module calculates a lambda setpoint value LAMB_SP_TQI depending on torque. IP_LAMB_DIF_SP is the
inverted map of IP_EFF_LAMB.
70.1.22 Adaptation of indicated engine torque
In system con?gurations with a torque sensor, this module is utilized to evaluate this sensor information for an
adaptation of the torque model. The torque model is adapted by means of an linear function, which is de?ned
by a slope FAC_TQI_AD_SLOP and an offset TQI_AD_OFS.
70.1.23 Engine Torque Status
In order to comply with the SAE J1979 regulation, a relative load value LOAD_CLC is calculated. According to
the legislative requirements, this load value must be dimensionless and should provide the service technician
with an indication of the percent engine capacity that is being used.
LV_ERR_TQI provides information about the accuracy/trustworthiness of the calculated torque value that is
transmitted via CAN. In case that a failure of a relevant sensor or actuator is detected, this ?ag is set to 1.
70.1.24 Minimum indicated engine torque offset during PUC
The output TQI_ADD_PUC is utilized as offset to the basic minimum indicated torque limitation in the module
?Minimum indicated engine torque at trailing throttle?. The offset is active during fuel cut-off only and ensures
a feasible manifold absolute pressure.
70.1.25 Minimum indicated engine torque offset during PUC (Appl.Inc.)
The output LV_MAP_PUC_LIM_ACT_LSL_GAIN_AD is utilized in the module ?Minimum indicated engine torque
offset during PUC?.
70.1.26 Indicated ef?ciency correction for project speci?c requirements
This module provides the possibility to implement project speci?c Torque model ef?ciency corrections.
The output EFF_TQI_COR_CUS is utilized in the calculation of the actual torque and the ignition angle set-
point.
The output EFF_TQI_COR_CUS_BAS is a input parameter for the calculation of EFF_TOT_BAS_SLOW and effects
the torque setpoint TQI_SP_MAF for the slow air path.

= cDe?ne NC_NR_TQ_CMB;". This means that every aggregate in every project can use the same name

� General Information
To be consistent with the speci?c ignition management during start phase, the ef?ciency must be initialised
during this phase. Otherwise, the ef?ciencies are calculated versus ignition deviations from the reference
value.
In case of engine with multiple cylinder bank con?guration (NC_CBK_EX_NR>1), for a more ef?cient modelling
and control of the exhaust gas temperature, a cylinder bank speci?c actual ignition ef?ciency is determined
for each bank.
In order to manage the knock effects on the torque co-ordination (unlocking of the knock control with the
throttle opening), two different ef?ciencies are calculated on the corrected basic ignition angle. The ?rst one
include the mean value of the knock correction, the second one only takes care of a ?ltered value of this
knock correction. In this way, the effect of the knock control on the torque management can be smoothened
according to the ?lter constant (and even inhibited if the ?lter constant is set to 0).
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, ES2ERU
Activation: LV_HOM_RUN==1
Deactivation: LV_HOM_RUN==0
Recurrence: 10MS, SEG

IN_NR] and the inner index k a range [1 to NC_NR_CASE_VVL].

EFF_IGA_BAS_COR_CBK_SEL[NC_CBK_IN_NR][NC_NR_CASE_VVL] and EFF_IGA_BAS_COR_KNK_FIL_CBK_SEL[NC_
CBK_IN_NR][NC_NR_CASE_VVL] are obtained by means of an interpolation routine from the map array IP_EFF_
IGA_VVL_CAM_L [NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H
[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] depending on port ?ap position (Flap closed
= 1 =>"H" and Flap opened = 0 =>"L"). The structure of this map array is depicted below.
Figure 70.4.9:
Formula section:
%Perform interpolation of tables IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] or IP_
EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] with the given IGA_DIF_BAS and store the
results in the intermediate array IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H_
RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) respectively.
IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM = IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L [k][ALL][ALL](IGA_DIF_BAS)
IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H_RAM = IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H[k][ALL][ALL](IGA_DIF_BAS)
%Perform table interpolation in IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H_RAM with the given
CAM_IN_i and CAM_EX_i
EFF_IGA_BAS_COR_CBK_SEL_i_k = IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM (CAM_IN_i, CAM_EX_i) or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_
H_RAM (CAM_IN_i, CAM_EX_i) depending on port ?ap position
%Perform interpolation of tables IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] or IP_
EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] with the given IGA_DIF_BAS_KNK_FIL and
store the results in the intermediate array IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_
CAM_H_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) respectively.

70.4.2.3.1.1.1 Interpolation procedure for calculation of EFF_IGA_MIN_CBK_SEL
This algorithm is dedicated only for con?gurations with NC_CBK_IN_NR = NC_NR_CBK_IVVT.
EFF_IGA_MIN_CBK_SEL[NC_CBK_IN_NR][NC_NR_CASE_VVL] is obtained by means of an interpolation routine
from the map array IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX]
or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] depending on port
?ap position (Flap closed = 1 =>"H" and Flap opened = 0 =>"L").
%Perform interpolation of tables IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] or IP_
EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] with the given IGA_DIF_MIN_i_k and store
the results in the intermediate array IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_
H_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) respectively.
IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM = IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L [k][ALL][ALL]( ](IGA_DIF_MIN_i_k)
IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H_RAM = IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H[k][ALL][ALL]( ](IGA_DIF_MIN_i_k)
%Perform table interpolation in IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H_RAM with the given
CAM_IN_i and CAM_EX_i
EFF_IGA_MIN_CBK_SEL_i_k = IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_L_RAM (CAM_IN_i, CAM_EX_i) or IP_EFF_IGA_VVL_CAM_H_
RAM (CAM_IN_i, CAM_EX_i) depending on port ?ap position.

IN_i, CAM_EX_i) depending on port ?ap position.

H_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) respectively.

� General Information
In homogeneous combustion mode (LV_HOM_RUN = 1), this module delivers the output IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ_
CBK_SEL. The Intake bank and VVL-position selective output IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ_CBK_SEL represents the ignition
retard with reference to IGA_REF_COR_CBK_SEL that is necessary to generate the indicated engine torque
TQI_SP_CBK_SEL. IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ_CBK_SEL is a function of the ignition angle ef?ciency setpoint EFF_IGA_SP_
CBK_SEL, which, in turn, is calculated out of the Reference Indicated Torque TQI_REF_CBK_SEL and the actual
ef?ciencies EFF_SCC_AV, EFF_EGR_HOM, and EFF_LAMB_AV.
During certain driving or operating modes (e.g. Economy Mode ), the ignition intervention will be disabled by
the Dynamic Torque Manager (i.e. LV_TQ_IGA_ACT = 0). In that case, IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ_CBK_SEL will be set to a
passive value of 95.625 �Crk, resulting in a ?nal ignition angle setpoint equal to IGA_BAS_COR_CBK_SEL.
In order to smooth the ignition angle setpoint behavior during transitions out of PUC, the ef?ciency EFF_SCC_
AV might be replaced by a passive value of 1. This option can be chosen by the calibration switch LC_EFF_
MOD_SCC (=0).
In order to meet the requirements of a system con?guration with Variable Valve Lift (VVL), IGA_DIF_TQ_REQ_
CBK_SEL and EFF_IGA_SP_CBK_SEL are calculated simultaneously for each Intake Bank and each position of
the Variable Valve Lift Actuator..
The torque setpoint TQI_SP_IGA is converted into a Bank/VVL position selective Setpoint TQI_SP_CBK_SEL to
account for the impact of the different torque loss contributions and for possbile setpoint limitations.

Deactivation: if activation not true

70.5.2.1.2.1 Calculation of TQI_SP_CBK_SEL_1_i_k
During pattern operation (cylinder banks have different valve lift settings), the instantaneous torque losses will
alternate from one segment to the other. In order to achieve a smooth engine torque output, the alternating
torque losses can be compensated by corresponding corrections in the setpoint for the indicated torque.
An translation table is used to adapt the TQ_LOSS_CBK_SEL index to the TQI_SP_CBK_SEL_1 index. This is
necessary for working with historical de?ntions of the NC for different versions of TQDR/TQLO.

70.5.2.3.3.1.1.1 Filtering of temporary ignition ef?ciency set point; EFF_IGA_SP
Spark ef?ciency curve is very ?at at close to ef?ciency 1, so that in this curve region small changes in TQI_
SP results in big changes of EFF_IGA_SP and thus ignition angle. For avoiding unstable spark the EFF_IGA_
SP_CBK_SEL is low pass ?ltered with IP_CRLC_EFF_IGA_SP_CBK_SEL_FIL/_IS. The ?ltering can be inhibited with
LC_EFF_IGA_SP_FIL_INH.

TQDR, Full load enrichment
� General Information
In order to maximize the torque output of the engine at higher loads, it is possible to operate the engine with
a richer fuel/air mixture. If full load conditions are detected (i.e. LV_FL=1), LAMB_FL will directly impact the
lambda setpoint in the module Lambda coordination .
LAMB_FL is calculated from the map IP_LAMB_FL_SP. In order to reduce torque jumps at transitions to and
from Full load, the algorithm offers the possibility to de?ne a ramp function for LAMB_FL by means of the
maps IP_LAMB_DEC_FL and IP_LAMB_INC_FL.
The value C_TIA_THD_LAMB_FL_SP enables to switch between to different maps depending on the intake air
temperature TIA.

Figure 70.7.6:
70.7.2.2.2.1 Calculation of fuel cut pattern enable conditions
70.7.2.2.2.1.1 Formula section
Calculation of enabling sequential fuel cut-off module:
If LV_ENA_SEQ_FCUT is enabled, the function sequential fuel cut-off and restart is authorized. If this bit gets
deactivated the algorithm is stopped immediately, sequence is stopped.
LV_ENA_SEQ_FCUT = 1 (reserved for speci?c deactivation conditions)
In this subsystem the activation conditions for the sequential method is calculated. If the output bits are active,
the controlled fuel cut-off and restart is allowed. In dynamic conditions for restart injection the sequence can
be ?nished immediately if the engine speed is close to idle speed conditions and decreasing fast. A second
case for an interrupt is sudden tip-in at running sequence. In case of transition PU to PUC with open drive train
at high load (e.g. gear shift) it is necessary to shut off the injection immediately. Under low load conditions the
sequential fuel cut off method can be authorized to get a smooth engine speed decrease.
In the case of a gearshift target speed intervention (e.g. dual clutch downshift), any pattern for the change
PUC to PU is interrupted. This allows a rapid increase of engine torque and results in a faster gearshift.
In the case of a positive gearbox intervention it is possible to interrupt any pattern for the change PUC to PU,
depending on the inhibit switch calibration.

� General Information
At a transition from trailing throttle to trailing throttle fuel cut off, torque jumps generally occur at trailing throttle
fuel cut off, which are noticeable as jerks in the vehicle.
To reduce the torque at this transition, the ignition timing is retarded and the combustion air is adjusted to
small values.
These procedures however do not always achieve the required torque reduction, because ignition timing and
combustion air can only be reduced so far, that a jerk free engine operation is still possible.
To support the above mentioned torque reduction method, it is possible to switched on and/or off the injection
for individual cylinders within a de?ned number of engine cycles (on and/or deactivation) in case of PUC and
re-entry into idle or trailing throttle mode.
For different conditions it is necessary to exit the fuel pattern transition to ensure fast acceleration or stable
engine speed. Interfaces are provided to stub the exit conditions to the transition algorithm.
Description of the sequential method
At a transition of engine states (visible in CASE_SEL_CYL)
from PU to PUC,
from PUC to IS or PUC,
from PUC to PL,
from PUC to PL due to TCU intervention,
from PU to PUC due to TCU intervention,
the sequence of complete combustion cycles can be in?uenced starting from 1 up to 8 combustion cycles,
e.g. in case of a 4-cylinder that is 8 x 720�CRK as one combustion cycle is 720 �CRK.
To realize this, the table ID_PAT_SEL_CYL contains the of injection pattern arranged along the shut off se-
quence.

TQDR, Sequential fuel cutoff and restart fuel feed
The number of the injection pattern directly corresponds to the number of deactivated cylinders in terms of
injection, e.g. NR_PAT_SEL_CYL = 2 means 2 cylinders are to be deactivated and for a 4-cylinder that would
mean a shut-off-percentage of 50%.
NR_SEL_CYL means the logical number in the shut off sequence (1...8).
The sequence counter uses NC_CYL_NR to de?ne its initial value.
Different drive train con?guration regarding transmission types are considered by a third dimension of the
array table ID_PAT_SEL_CYL.
Handling of reactivation functions (out of PUC):
Injection (Reactivation fuel feed) : To ensure, that all cylinders get at least once the same amount of TI_ADD_
REAC,
TI_ADD_REAC is not decremented as long as sequential transition PUC ( IS resp. PUC ( PL is ongoing.
Ignition: The according reactivation functions are not concerned by sequential transition functions.
Handling of engine states:
The detection of PU, PUC, PL and IS is not concerned by sequential transition functions.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: if activation not true
Recurrence: SEG

Figure 70.8.3:
70.8.2.1 Case selector
The case selector identi?es the relevant engine state transitions that are:
- Case 1: transition from PU to PUC (fuel feed cut-off)
- Case 2: transition from PUC to PU or to IS (fuel feed restart)
- Case 3: transition from PUC (fuel feed restart)
- Case 4: transition from PUC (fuel feed restart) for TCU intervention
- Case 5: transition from PU to PUC (fuel feed cut-off) after TCU intervention
Case selection is active when no transition is running.

70.8.2.2.1 Calculations for the sequential method selected and activated
When the sequential method is authorized and an engine state transition case is active, the following algorithm
is calculated:
- Select input values for transition function depending on case.
- Calculate function for transition case (SUB_TRAN_CASE).
An engine cycle counter counts up NR_SEL_CYL to the highest position of ID_PAT_SEL_CYL each 720� CRK
based on a segment counter.
The transition pattern indexes are adjustable in the table ID_PAT_SEL_CYL. The patterns are applicable per
transition table (see module "Cylinder shut-off" of aggregate INJR).
Example for shut-off sequences with 8 levels and a shut-off pattern for the 4 next injections (4-cylinder)

Figure 70.8.24:
70.8.2.2.1.7.1.2.3.1 Pattern index calculation
Via LC_CASE_3_SEL_CYL_ENA it is possible to calculate the restart fuel-feed sequence from ID_PAT_SEL_CYL_
CASE_3 instead of ID_PAT_SEL_CYL. This way the restart can be calibrated depending on the load varied over
N/GEAR. If LC_PAT_SEL_CYL_OFS is enabled, this load dependency is calculated through the complete restart
fuel-feed sequence leading to a modi?cation of the pattern sequence. If disabled, the restart fuel-feed sequence
is selected at the start of the transition and runs through unmodi?ed. However, the sequence still can be
interrupted on request (LV_FCUT_CDN_PUC_PL).
Since the pattern sequence in ID_PAT_SEL_CYL_CASE_3 can be both increasing or decreasing a variable limiter
is available to avoid that a restarted cylinder is shut-off again. C_NR_PAT_SEL_CYL_LIM_MOD is 1 for decreas-
ing calibration of ID_PAT_SEL_CYL_CASE_3 (NR_SEL_CYL), zero for increasing calibration. Any value greater 1
disables the limiter.

� General Information
Legal requirement according to California code regulation 1968.2 (e) (11):
Cold start emission reduction strategy monitoring.
If a vehicle incorporates a speci?c engine control strategy to reduce cold start emissions, the OBD II system
shall monitor the commanded elements for proper function (e.g., increased engine idle speed, commanded
ignition timing retard, etc.), other than secondary air, while the control strategy is active to ensure proper
operation of the control strategy.
This module describes the technical solution of the ignition angle ef?ciency monitoring to ful?ll the legal re-
quirement.

70.9.1.2 Initialization of NVMY data in case of EEPROM error
Default values in case of check-sum error are 0.
70.9.1.3 Restore NVMY data
At ECU reset EFF_IGA_CST_QUO_ IS/PL_MAX are restored from NVMY memory.
70.9.1.4 Store NVMY data
At end of power-latch phase EFF_IGA_CST_QUO_ IS/PL_MAX are stored into NVMY.
70.9.2 Formula section
70.9.2.1 Calculation of ignition angle ef?ciency due to catalyst heating request
The torque reserve for catalyst heating TQ_ADD_CH_DIAG is transformed into a set point for the ignition angle
ef?ciency EFF_IGA_SP_CH used to realize this reserve.
70.9.2.1.1 Set point calculation
EFF_IGA_SP_CH is calculated based on TQ_ADD_CH_DIAG from EXTC. The set point is limited to maximum
value of 1.

70.9.2.1.2 Calculation of minimum time during catalyst heating
During catalyst heating the timer T_CH_CST is increased when EFF_IGA_SP_CH is below 1. The timer starts to
run when LV_ST_END switches to 1.
When the timer reaches the threshold C_T_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST the ?ag LV_T_MIN_CH_CST is set. This ?ag is
evaluated for RBM indicating that minimum time during catalyst heating was reached.

70.9.2.2 Diagnostic function
The difference between the actual ignition angle ef?ciency and set point, limited by the minimum ignition
angle ef?ciency, is integrated for the engine phases "idle speed" and "part load" separately. The integrated
values are normalized by division with the accumulated time spent in the respective engine phases. The
symptoms LV_SYM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS/PL are set accordingly if the normalized integration values exceed the
respective maximum thresholds. The maximum drag indicators are stored in the nonvolatile memory. The
drag indicators can be cleared by calibration or customer test interface.
Three cases are distinguished:
1. Catalyst heating active
2. End of catalyst heating (1 recurrence after Catalyst heating active)
3. Diagnostic not active

70.9.2.2.1 Catalyst heating active
Following functionality is executed when catalyst heating is active and no inhibition of the diagnostic is present.
70.9.2.2.1.1 Calculation of ignition angle ef?ciency difference
The difference between ignition angle actual value and catalyst heating set point is calculated. This difference
is weighted with a factor depending on the accumulated PD-part for fast-path of torque coordination. This
accumulated PD-part is normalized to unit [-] in the variable CTR_SUM_TQ_DIF_P_D_FAST.

70.9.2.2.1.2 Ignition angle ef?ciency quotient in idle speed
Ignition angle ef?ciency difference is integrated and normalized with the variable CTR_SUM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS.
Enabling condition for the integrator is that the ignition angle ef?ciency set point is below the maximum C_
EFF_IGA_SP_CH_THD_IS and engine state is IS or PU. When these conditions are ful?lled a timer is running in
order to calculate the quotient of integrated ignition angle ef?ciency CTR_SUM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS and to set a
?ag when minimum time during catalyst heating for the diagnostic is reached.
Furthermore bit 0 of LF_STATE_DGO_EFF_IGA_CST_IS is set the enabling conditions in order to indicate that
diagnostic conditions are ful?lled and bit 2 is set to 1 in order to indicate that the diagnostic result is not yet
de-bounced.

70.9.2.2.2 Symptom evaluation at end of catalyst heating
The symptom detection and calculation of the drag indicators is done at the end of every catalyst heating
phase once (if diagnosis was not inhibited). For error-free ?eld trial of the catalyst heating quality the symptom
delivery to ERRM can be suppressed by calibration.
70.9.2.2.2.1 Symptom evaluation for idle speed
If the quotient of ignition angle ef?ciency integral is above the threshold de?ned by IP_INT_EFF_IGA_SP_CH_
QUO_IS_MAX the symptom is present. It can be suppressed by mean of the calibration switch LC_INH_SYM_
EFF_IGA_CST.
The maximum quotient is stored to the variable EFF_IGA_CST_QUO_IS_MAX (in [%]) as trailing indicator.
The symptom information is stored in bit 1 of LF_STATE_DGO_EFF_IGA_CST_IS and the information that the
symptom was de-bounced (LV_T_MIN_EFF_IGA_CST_IS=1; means time during catalyst heating long enough) is
stored in bit 2 (set to 0 if LV_T_MIN_EFF_IGA_CST_IS=1).

TQDR, Ignition angle ef?ciency diagnosis (error management interface)
This module de?nes the interface functionality between main module for Ignition angle ef?ciency monitor-
ing and error management (ERRM). This variant covers for ERRM 7.x.
Main interface variable is LF_STATE_DGO_EFF_IGA_CST_IS and LF_STATE_DGO_EFF_IGA_CST_PL.
These bit coded variables have following meaning:
Bit 0: Condition ful?lled if set to 1
Bit 1: Failure symptom present if set to 1
Bit 2: Failure not yet de-bounced if set to 1; only used if ?lter service from ERRM not used.
Examples:
LF_STATE_DGO_EFF_IGA_CST_IS/PL set to ...
0: no diagnostic condition
1: condition and no symptom, diagnostic passed.
3: condition and symptom present; diagnostic failed
5: condition and no symptom, not yet de-bounced
7: condition and symptom present, not yet de-bounced

Diagnostic Instance Diagnostic initialisation function NR_CONF

70.10.2.3 Freeze Frame Triggering
The diagnostic evaluation is done for both areas (idle and part-load) at the end of catalyst heating. This is
the reason why by transition from one area to the other a Pre-Freeze Frame must be shot for the case the
diagnostic threshold was overridden.

TQDR, Ignition angle ef?ciency diagnosis (Appl. Inc.)
The ignition angle ef?ciency diagnosis for catalyst heating at cold start CSERS. This module
provides the diagnoses inhibition and the rate based monitoring interface.
70.11.1 Inhibition of ignition angle ef?ciency monitoring function
� General Information
For main diagnostic module the inhibition information LV_INH_DIAG_EFF_IGA_CST is calculated.
Other function might need the activation information LV_DIAG_CST_ACT.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: At RST:
LV_DIAG_CST_ACT = 0
LV_INH_DIAG_EFF_IGA_CST = 1
Activation: always
Deactivation: if activation not true
Recurrence: 100MS
� Function Description
If STATE_CH == 1 and
TCO_ST >= C_TCO_ST_MIN_DIAG_CST and
TCO_ST <= C_TCO_ST_MAX_DIAG_CST
Then
LV_DIAG_CST_ACT = 1
Else
LV_DIAG_CST_ACT = 0
Endif
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(NC_FID_ERR_EFF_IGA_CST, PRM_LV_PRMS)
If TCO_ST < C_TCO_ST_MIN_DIAG_CST or
TCO_ST > C_TCO_ST_MAX_DIAG_CST or
T_AST <= C_T_AST_MIN_EFF_IGA_CST or
PRM_LV_PRMS == 0
Then
LV_INH_DIAG_EFF_IGA_CST = 1
Else
LV_INH_DIAG_EFF_IGA_CST = 0
Endif
70.11.2 Rate based monitoring interface
� General Information
Interface between monitors and rate-based monitoring functionality is mainly realized with 3 actions:
- ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorNumFor
- ACTION_ERRM_IncRbmMonitorDenFor
- ACTION_ERRM_LockRbmMonitorFor
STATE_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS/PL variables are only used to ease computations and testing.
These two actions shall be called to increment individual numerator/denominator of related monitor.
Within STATE_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS/PL, three different kinds of information are de?ned:
- Conditions for monitoring are met long enough to detect malfunction (bit 0)
(no intrusive operation, no short trip)
- Monitor disabled because of system malfunction (bit 1)
(depending on failure status: pending)
- Monitor individual RBM conditions encountered within this DC (bit 2)

70.11.3 ACTION_TQDR_IniRbmEffIgaCstIs
This Action is called by ERRM aggregate each time:
- a new evaluation of rate-based monitoring data for this monitor is required or
- monitor inhibition shall be removed (bit 1 = 0) because Mode $04 was called (ERRM data cleared).
If PRM_TYP_INI == ?REST?
Then
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS = 0
Else (PRM_TYP_INI == ?CLR?)
bit 1 of STATE_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST_IS = 0
Endif
70.11.4 ACTION_TQDR_IniRbmEffIgaCstPl
This Action is called by ERRM aggregate each time:
- a new evaluation of rate-based monitoring data for this monitor is required or
- monitor inhibition shall be removed (bit 1 = 0) because Mode $04 was called (ERRM data cleared).
If PRM_TYP_INI == ?REST?
Then
bit 0, bit 1 and bit 2 of STATE_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST_PL = 0
Else (PRM_TYP_INI == ?CLR?)
bit 1 of STATE_RBM_EFF_IGA_CST_PL = 0
Endif

� General Information
This module delivers the reference indicated engine torque TQI_REF, basic indicated engine torque TQI_BAS
and other basic torque values for the torque model in homogeneous combustion mode.
In order to meet the requirements of a system con?guration with Variable Valve Lift (VVL), TQI_REF is also
calculated simultaneously for each Intake Bank and each position of the Variable Valve Lift Actuator (TQI_REF_
CBK_SEL)
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, ES2ERU
Activation: 10MS: LV_HOM_RUN
SEG: LV_HOM_RUN
Deactivation: !LV_HOM_RUN
Recurrence: 10MS, SEG

70.12.2.1.2.2.1.1 Reference torque - map array interpolation
This algorithm is dedicated only for con?gurations with NC_CBK_IN_NR = NC_NR_CBK_IVVT.
TQI_REF_CBK_SEL[NC_CBK_IN_NR][NC_NR_CASE_VVL] is obtained by means of a interpolation routine from
the map array IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_L [NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] or IP_
TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_H [NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX] depending on port ?ap
position (Flap closed = 1 =>"H", Flap opened = 0 =>"L). The structure of this map array is depicted below.

70.13.2.2.2.2.1.1 Interpolation procedure for calculation of TQI_REF_CBK_SEL
This algorithm is dedicated only for con?gurations with NC_CBK_IN_NR = NC_NR_CBK_IVVT.
TQI_REF_CBK_SEL_SEG[NC_CBK_IN_NR][NC_NR_CASE_VVL] is obtained by means of a interpolation routine
from the map array IP_TQI_REF_N_M_AIR_VVL_CAM_L[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_
IVVT_EX] or IP_TQI_REF_N_M_AIR_VVL_CAM_H[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN] [NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_EX]
depending on the port ?ap position (Flap closed = 1 = >"H" and Flap opened = 0 = >"L"). The structure of this
map array is depicted below.

%Perform interpolation of tables IP_TQI_REF_N_M_AIR_VVL_CAM_L[k][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_IN][NC_NR_IDX_IVVT_

MAF_FG_CYL_IGN_i_k and store the results in the intermediate array IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_L_RAM(CAM_IN,
CAM_EX) or IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_H_RAM(CAM_IN, CAM_EX) respectively.
IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_L_RAM = IP_TQI_REF_N_M_AIR_VVL_CAM_L [k][ALL][ALL](N_32, MAF_FG_CYL_IGN_i_k)
IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_H_RAM = IP_TQI_REF_N_M_AIR_VVL_CAM_H [k][ALL][ALL](N_32, MAF_FG_CYL_IGN_i_k)

CAM_IN_i and CAM_EX_i
TQI_REF_i_k = IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_L_RAM (CAM_IN_i, CAM_EX_i) or IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM_H_RAM (CAM_IN_i,
CAM_EX_i) depending on port ?ap postion.

70.13.2.2.2.2.3.2 Correction of ignition angle setpoint during VVL switching
In case of the modeled air mass during valve lift switching is not accurate enough, it?s possible to correct
directly the ignition angle for achieving a torque neutral lift switch.

This strategy is enabled/disabled by a
compiler switch based on NC_CONF_TQDR_D03H.bit0
If the compiler switch is not active, the correction factor FAC_EFF_IGA_VVL_CBK_SEL is not used

engine torque has also to be done.

If IGSP aggregate is calculated at every segment, the parallel segment calculation of IGA_AV done here is
not necessary. So in this case it?s recommended to set LC_ENA_IGA_AV_EFF_IGA_CLC = 1 for using the IGSP

70.13.2.4.1 TQI_BAS-model for VVL-transitions
Since the basic torque can jump in VVL con?gurations an arti?cial value is needed during VVL transitions
to prevent torque jumps due to not torque neutral interventions. This arti?cial value is TQI_BAS_VVL_TRAN. It
provides a smooth transition during lift switch and a value equal to the regular TQI_BAS at steady conditions.

70.13.2.4.1.5 State transition to higher torque value
The difference of TQI_BAS in high lift to low lift or Port open to port closed is weighted with the convergence
factor and added to the last value (frozen) at activated low lift or port position. If the factor reaches its maximum
value one the state information is updated.

70.13.2.4.2.2 State transition to higher torque value
The difference of TQI_BAS in high lift to low lift or Port open to port closed is weighted with the convergence
factor and added to the last value (frozen) at activated low lift or port position. If the factor reaches its maximum
value one the state information is updated.

Figure 70.13.55:
70.13.2.4.3.2 Calculation of TQ_REF_MAF_SP_PORT_DIF_CBK_SEL
When the port ?aps (Ladungbewegungsklappen) close, the air inlet section is reduced. This causes a decrease
in the intake air mass and a sudden reduction of the generated torque.
In order to avoid such consequences, a torque reserve must be built up when the port ?ap is about to get
closed.
The difference between available basic torque with open and closed port ?ap positions is the basis for the
torque reserve calculation in TQSP Torque reserve coordination (Appl. Inc.).
This reference torque difference is calculated here in this subsystem.

� Import actions:
ACTION_FARM_GetPermission(IN <PRM_FID>, OUT <PRM_LV_PRMS>)
� General Information
The CVT offers a torque information measured by a sensor. So the ECU has the possiblity to adapt the differ-
ence between the claculated torque at clutch and the measured value. The result of the adaptation is a better
scaling of the calculated engine torque.
The adaptation sequence is executed in case of idle speed and eqiupped CVT only. The input of the func-
tionality is the actual calculated engine torque without external requests (TQI_EMS TQ_LOSS) and the received
torque at clutch (measured by the torque sensor in the CVT).
As soon as the adaptation conditions are ful?lled, a fraction of the difference between the calculated engine
torque and the measured torque is adapted each calculation cycle. The adaptation value is limited to MIN/
MAX- values. In case of exit the activation condition the actual adapted value is stored.
In case of reset the ECU, FAC_TQI_AD_SLOP and TQI_AD_OFS are initialized to default values (1.000 for slope
and 0 Nm for offset).
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: never
Recurrence: 10MS

� General Information
In this module a customer speci?c torque based lambda setpoint LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS is calculated. The activa-
tion of this lambda setpoint is based on the engine operating point. If the engine runs for a adjustable time
above a torque threshold, then a special enrichment via lambda setpoint is calculated. The variable LAMB_
SP_TQI_CUS can be used due to engine hardware restrictions (for example an engine run without full load
enrichment or overheating prevention under high load conditions).
This calculated lambda setpoint is transferred to the lambda coordination and is considered via MIN selec-
tion.

70.15.2 Calculation
70.15.2.1 Calculation of LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS
Is the engine operating point is above a threshold (ID_RNG_LAMB_SP_TQI_ACT = 1), a time counter (T_RNG_
LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS) starts. If this timer exceeds the threshold C_T_MAX_RNG_LAMB_SP_TQI, then the calcula-
tion is active. If the engine operating point is below a threshold (ID_RNG_LAMB_SP_TQI_DEAC = 1), then the
counter is reseted and the LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS is calculated via "inactive" path.

70.15.2.1.2 Conditions inactive
In the inactive path the variables are set to neutral values in case of LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS is greather than the
maximum selection LAMB_SP. If the LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS calculation was not active, this case is the normal case.
After a active LAMB_SP_TQI_CUS calculation, the enrichment is ramped to a lean value using the limitation
gradient IP_LGRD_LAMB_SP_TQI_DEAC. If the enrichment exceeds the leanest LAMB_SP value, the function is
deactivated.

� General Information
The output parameter M_AIR_CYL_SP_TQI_CBK_SEL represents the bank and VVL position selective mass air
?ow setpoint for the homogeneous combustion mode. It is utilized as an input parameter for the reverse
Intake Manifold Model, where it is translated into a setpoint for the opening angle of the throttle blade. M_
AIR_CYL_SP_TQI_CBK_SEL is obtained from the map IP_MAF_STK_SP_VVL (inverse map of IP_TQI_REF_VVL) as
a function of engine speed N_32 and the corrected torque setpoint TQI_SP_MAF_CBK_SEL.
The torque setpoint TQI_SP_MAF_CBK_SEL is principially a function of TQI_SP_SLOW and EFF_TOT_BAS_SLOW_
CBK_SEL. Since the engine requires a minimum amount of air/fuel mixture for stable combustion, TQI_SP_MAF_
CBK_SEL is limited to TQI_MIN_PU at light load conditions. In the case of fuel cut off (LV_PUC = 1), TQI_MIN_PU
is utilized to control the absolute pressure in the intake manifold.
In order to meet the requirements of a system con?guration with Variable Valve Lift (VVL), TQI_SP_MAF_CBK_
SEL and M_AIR_CYL_SP_TQI_CBK_SEL are calculated simultaneously for each Intake Bank and each position of
the Variable Valve Lift Actuator..
The slow path setpoint TQI_SP_SLOW is converted into a Bank/VVL position selective Setpoint to account for
the impact of the different torque loss contributions..

{p. 7530}
� General Information
For certain modes of fuel injection deactivation it might be necessary to have a correspond-ing basic ef?ciency
for fuel cut-off (e.g. cylinder bank deactivation). There can also be more than one mode with a certain ef?ciency,
so this needs to be coordinated.
This module can be adapted to project speci?c needs for calculation of EFF_SCC_BAS. With the logical variable
LV_EFF_BAS_REQ the value EFF_SCC_BAS is obtained from EFF_SCC_BAS_REQ.
� Application Conditions

Recurrence: 10MS
Activation: LV_ES==0
Deactivation: LV_ES==1

� General Information
The objective of this module is to generate a torque intervention by fuel cut-off pattern.
This torque intervention could be caused by several conditions which are summarized in the label LV_AUTH_
TQ_PAT (see chapter 1.1.1 "Authorization for single cylinder cut-off"). The label LV_FCUT_FAST can be used for
project speci?c fast fuel cut-off conditions.
Based on the TQI_REQ_FAST and the TQI_REF corrected with the basic a/f ratio ef?ciency and the ignition
angle ef?ciency an ef?ciency setpoint for the single cylinder cut-off EFF_SCC_SP is calculated, which leads to
the pattern index NR_PAT_SCC (see chapter 1.1.3 "Setpoint ef?ciency fuel cut-off").
In general, a torque reduction could be realized by spark retarding or single cylinder cut-off. With the scaling
factor FAC_IGA_MIN_TEG_IGA_BAS a scaling between earliest cylinder cut-off (no spark retarding) and latest
cylinder cut-off (full spark retarding up to IGA_MIN) can be realized (see chapter 1.1.2 "Determination of scaling
factor").

70.18.2 Formula Section
70.18.2.1 Authorization of Torque based Pattern
The authorization ?ag is set depending on:
- a manual enabling =>ID_AUTH_TQ_PAT_CASE_SEL (Authorization of fuel cut-off pattern via case selector for
cylinder speci?c transitions PU-PUC, PUC-IS or PUC-PL)
- a request from torque management =>LV_TQ_SCC_REQ and LV_TQ_SCC_INH
- a request from safety concept =>LV_TQ_LIM_INTV (see module "Torque request for safety")
- other project speci?c requests for fast fuel cut-off =>LV_FCUT_FAST without control of dynamic torque man-
agement
Due to logical calibration constants nearly all of these request can be inhibited, except of the request from
safety concept LV_TQ_LIM_INTV.

70.18.2.2 Calculation of Pattern Number
Depending on the authorization ?ag LV_AUTH_TQ_PAT the ef?ciency EFF_SCC_SP is set to the calculated value
EFF_SCC_SP_1 or is set equal to "1". Additionally, two application labels allow to manipulate the ef?ciency setpoint
(LC_EFF_SCC_SP_MAN and C_EFF_SCC_SP_MAN). Depending on the ef?ciency setpoint a pattern is calculated.
To avoid uncomfortable jumps of pattern, if the setpoint EFF_SCC_SP jitters, the calculation of the pattern index
NR_PAT_SCC is done by applying a hysteresis C_EFF_SCC_SP_HYS on EFF_SCC_SP.

with the basic ef?ciencies for a/f ratio and ignition angle. The ef?ciency set point is limited to a minimum
de?ned by EFF_SCC_SP_MIN and a maximum of 1.

70.18.2.2.1.1 Rate Limitation
Changes of the ef?ciency EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG have to be limited in falling direction to avoid high frequent jumps
between pattern and spark retarding. Therefore a calibratable rate limit function is added. The principle appli-
cation parameters for these rate limitations are C_MIN_DEC_EFF_IG_MIN_TEG_1, C_MIN_DEC_EFF_IG_MIN_TEG_2
and C_HYS_EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG.

Figure 70.19.4:
70.19.2.1 Calculation of Scaling Factor
The factor FAC_IGA_MIN_TEG_IGA_BAS is used to scale between the ef?ciencies EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG (corrected
minimum ignition angle including spark retard limitation due to exhaust gas temperature) and EFF_IGA_BAS_
COR (corrected basic ignition angle without spark retard limitation due to exhaust gas temperature). For a
torque intervention due to gear shift, traction control, engine speed limitation and fast fuel cutoff the possibility
of deactivating this scaling factor must be realized. So the scaling factor can be set equal to "1", if one of that
interventions is active and if this method will be allowed (LC_ENA_FCUT_FAST_TOT = 1 or LC_ENA_TQ_SCC_
REQ_TOT). It is also set equal to "1", if the basic ef?ciency for fuel cutoff is smaller than "1".

ble to re-enable a calibratable amount of SCC-ef?ciency, in order to accelerate the reactivation of the off cylin-
ders. This leads to a better following behavior of torque.

70.19.2.3 Limitation of ef?ciency setpoint for single
During gear shift (LV_GS_DEC_ACT=1) the minimum ef?ciency setpoint for single cylinder shut-off is evaluated.
Depending on transmission type (TRANS_TYP) and pre-calculated ef?ciency for single cylinder shut-off (EFF_
SCC_SP_THE) the minimum ef?ciency setpoint is de?ned via 2 maps (sport mode / D mode).
If VVL system is faulty, the cylinder deactivation during gearshift must be disabled. Otherwise the emission
levels may increase due to the new engine working points after VVL is not working

� General Information
The map IP_TQI_REF is de?ned in the module Reference and Basic Torque . Note that the original breakpoint
MAF_STK_FG_PRED is replaced by the breakpoint M_AIR_CYL_MAX_COR!
TQI_POW_MAX_REQ_CLU is de?ned in the module Torque based engine power limitation and describes the
upper limit for the maximum indicated engine torque. This parameter can be utilized to perform temporary
or permanent torque limitations (e.g. overboost, customer torque limitation) that shall not lead to a backlash
at high pedal values.
TQI_BAS_MAX represents the maximum available Basic indicated torque and is utilized in the Torque Reserve
Coordination.

� General Information
TQI_MIN_REQ_PU, which is calculated from the 2-d map IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU(N_32, TCO) and the 1-d map IP_
TQI_MIN_REQ_PU_OFS_AMP(AMP), is the minimum requested indicated torque if the driver is off the pedal. TQ_
MIN_REQ_PU is obtained as maximum between (TQI_MIN_REQ_PU+TQ_LOSS_REQ_CLU) and IP_TQ_MIN_REQ_
CLU. Here, the map IP_TQ_MIN_REQ_CLU offers the possibility to de?ne a ?xed minimum torque at clutch.
The map IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU works in combination with map IP_TQI_MIN_PU and has to be tuned in parallel
with it. In PU phase both maps determines the steady state ignition angle.
IP_TQI_MIN_PU determines the load whereas IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU affects the ignition angle. If both are equal
the ignition angle in PU is identical with IGA_BAS_COR. If IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU is zero and TQ_MIN_CLU identical
with TQ_LOSS then the ignition angle is at IGA_MIN. So the ignition angle in PU can be shifted from IGA_MIN to
IGA_BAS_COR by adjusting IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU.

� General Information
The output TQI_ADD_PUC is utilized as offset to the basic minimum indicated torque limitation in the mod-
ule Minimum indicated engine torque at trailing throttle. The offset is active during fuel cut-off only and
ensures a feasible manifold absolute pressure.
The additive torque TQI_ADD_PUC is depending on engine speed and actual fuel cut-off ef?ciency.

added to the default offset. Here, the ramp factor FAC_TQI_MAP_PUC_LIM is calculated with the following

Figure 70.23.5:
70.23.2.2.1 Calculation of the minimum torque limit for opening the throttle at PUC phase
If the request for opening the throttle during PUC phase -so engine response when driver accelerates again is
improved- is set a speci?c minimum torque limitation at PUC is calculated. This minimum torque limit increase
the torque setpoint for the airpath, and the throttle is open.
The minimum torque limit is calculated out of a set of basic maps selected depending on current driving mode
and gear lever position
This basic torque limit is corrected by several factors:
- Factor based on exhaust system temperature for avoiding too fast cooling of catalyst converter

TQDR, Minimum indicated engine torque offset during PUC
- Factor based in time since the functionality for opening the throttle at PUC was activated
- Factor based gear and engine speed, for improving the comfort by closing/opening the throttle at low
Calibration hint for ID_IDX_TQI_ADD_PUC_OPEN_THR
- LDP_SEL_PSN_TQI_ADD_PUC_OPEN must be calibrated with values 0 and 1
- Choose by means of CLF_SEL_PSN_TQI_PUC_OPEN_THR the gearbox lever positions which corresponds to
Sport engine settings.
The throttle offset during PUC for the selected gearbox lever positions can be calibrated in the maps selected
by ID_IDX_TQI_ADD_PUC_OPEN_THR[LF_DRIV_MOD, 1] For the rest of gearbox lever positions the offset map
is choose by ID_IDX_TQI_ADD_PUC_OPEN_THR[LF_DRIV_MOD,0]

Figure 70.23.6:
70.23.2.2.1.1 Calculation of the minimum torque limit for opening the throttle at PUC phase
If the request for opening the throttle during PUC phase -so engine response when driver accelerates again is
improved- is set a speci?c minimum torque limitation at PUC is calculated. This minimum torque limit increase
the torque setpoint for the airpath, and the throttle is open.
The minimum torque offset is set directly to 0 Nm if the engine state leaves PUC phase.
In case of the request for opening the throttle in PUC is removed, but engine state is still PUC, the speci?c
torque limitation is ramped softly to 0 Nm by means of a gradient limiter
The basic maps for calculation of the minimum torque limit depend on the of different inlet valve lifting curves
NC_NR_VVL_IN
Several corrections are applied to the basic minimum torque limit for opening the throttle at PUC.

70.23.2.2.1.1.1 Basic value of minimum torque at PUC for opening the throttle in PUC
For opening the throttle during PUC, the "Minimum indicated engine torque offset during PUC" must be incre-
mented. Here the basic value is calculated out of a basic look-up table and a correction factor.
Several basic look-up tables are available, and in case of it changes while it?s requested to open the throttle
during PUC, a ramp is calculated for smoothing the transition between both maps

70.23.2.2.3.1 Adaption of vector based on NC_NR_VVL_IN to vector based on NC_NR_CASE_VVL with NC_
NR_CASE_VVL>NC_NR_VVL_IN
[#NC_NR_CASE_VVL >NC_NR_VVL_IN]
The dimension of the vector TQI_ADD_PUC_OPEN_THR containing the torque offset for opening the throttle at
PUC phase depends on NC_NR_VVL_IN -Number of different inlet valve lifting curves.
The dimension of the vector TQI_ADD_PUC_CBK_VVL containing the ?nal torque value used for controlling the
throttle during PUC, depends on NC_NR_CASE_VVL -Total number of cases with different valve lifting curves.
So in case of NC_NR_CASE_VVL >NC_NR_VVL_IN, it?s necessary to de?ne which positions of TQI_ADD_PUC_
CBK_VVL[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] must be overwritten with TQI_ADD_PUC_OPEN_THR[NC_NR_VVL_IN]
The parameter C_NR_PSN_TQI_ADD_PUC_THR[NC_NR_CASE_VVL] de?nes it.
For example:
-NC_NR_VVL_IN=2
-NC_NR_CASE_VVL=4
-Following order is de?ned:
TQI_ADD_..._CBK_VVL[ IN_L&EX_L IN_L&EX_H IN_H&EX_L IN_H&EX_H ]
TQI_ADD_...THR[IN_L IN_H ]
Then C_NR_PSN_TQI_ADD_PUC_THR = [ 0 0 1 1 ]

� General Information
In case of homogeneous combustion, TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL is the minimum limitation for TQI_SP_MAF_CBK_
SEL at trailing throttle condition to ensure either a safe combustion process at low load conditions or a feasible
manifold absolute pressure during fuel cut-off. It is formed by a basic limitation TQI_MIN_PU__CBK_VVL_1, an
AMP correction offset TQI_MIN_PU_OFS_AMP_CBK_VVL, and, during trailing throttle fuel cut-off, by an additional
offset TQI_ADD_PUC_CBK_VVL.
The parameter LV_TQI_BOL_SET indicates that a minimum indicated engine torque has been reached. The
test for this condition can be performed in three different modes. LV_TQI_BOL_SET is utilized to trigger state
transitions in the Aggegate Engine Operating States (ENOS).
The parameter LV_TQI_BOL_MAF_SET is set to 1 if the minimum engine load (air path) has been reached. It is
utilized in Dynamic Torque Request Coordination .

TQDR, Single cylinder cut off basic and actual ef?ciency
� Import actions:
ACTION_INJR_GetLfStateIvPrev(IN <PRM_CYL>, OUT <PRM_LV_STATE_IV_PREV>)
� General Information
Calculation of EFF_SCC_BAS
EFF_SCC_BAS is the basic ef?ciency for single cylinder fuel cut-off and is utilized during permanent fuel cut-
off interventions (e.g. cylinder bank speci?c fuel cut-off). With an external request from "Basic fuel cut-off
coordination", a requested basic ef?ciency is applied. A calibrateable constant can be set for the basic ef?ciency,
if enabled.
Calculation of EFF_SCC_AV
EFF_SCC_AV is the ef?ciency that represents the actual impact of fuel cut-off interventions on the indicated
engine torque.
Every fuel cut-off intervention deriving from
- pattern (engine speed limitation, ASR, GS, etc.)
- trailing throttle fuel cut-off
- mis?re
- engine stop
is considered.
The calculation of this parameter can be performed in two alternative ways (by means of LC_EFF_SCC_AV_
MOD_SEL).
Mode_1 (LC_EFF_SCC_AV_MOD_SEL=0):
The value is calculated as the number of opened injectors at the last two revolutions divided by the number
of cylinders NC_CYL_NR. The input value PREV_STATE_IV (byte) de?nes the status of each injector during the
last ?nished injection cycle. If a cylinder-allocated bit of PREV_STATE_IV is active, the injection was performed
for the respective cylinder.
The injection information in PREV_STATE_IV is used to calculate a vertical sum. This sum is stored in SUM_
PREV_STATE_IV. The value SUM_PREV_STATE_IV_OLD is the stored vertical sum from the segment n-1.
Mode_2 (LC_EFF_SCC_AV_MOD_SEL=1):
The value is calculated as ratio between the number of injected cylinders for the next injection cycle (NC_
CYL_NR - SUM_INH_INJ) and the total number of cylinders NC_CYL_NR. The value SUM_INH_INJ is calculated in
the module Cylinder Shut-off and represents the number of deactivated injectors for the following injection
cycle.

� General Information
TQI_AV is the actual indicated engine torque produced either in homogeneous or strati?ed combustion mode.
The combustion mode is indicated by the logical variable LV_S_ACT (1 ... strati?ed combustion; 0 ... homoge-
neous combustion).
Dependent on LV_VVL_CLC_ENA, which is indicating active VLFT_1 calculations, as well as the segment time
greater than 10MS. the calculation of this module is done in 10MS grid otherwise in segment based grid.
As input for the TQI_AV calculation the delayed TQI_REF is selected, which is delayed via MAF in aggregate
INSY with a calibration constant.

� General Information
In order to comply with the SAE J1979 regulation, a relative load value LOAD_CLC is calculated. According to
the legislative requirements, this load value must be dimensionless and should provide the service technician
with an indication of the percent engine capacity that is being used.
LV_ERR_TQI provides information about the accuracy/trustworthiness of the calculated torque value that is
transmitted via CAN. In case that a failure of a relevant sensor or actuator is detected, this ?ag is set to 1.

70.29.3.1 Calculation of LV_ERR_TQI
For control modules like TCU and traction control, it is important to know whether the torque data transmitted
via CAN is accurate or not. Accuracy is lower than normal if one or more errors are present.
Please note that LV_ERR_TQI is not handled by the error memory management.

70.29.3.1.4 Sensor failures
NC_FID_TQI_MIS is an array indicating which, if any, cylinders are mis?ring. The calibration constant repre-
sents the torque error due to mis?re in a single cylinder. The total torque error is therefore this constant
File: AED01I01.00B
25473Project: VW SIMOS 18.1 EA888 Document key: 10213413 SPE 000 DE
Baseline: SC8L50Y0 Copyright Continental AG

Copyright �Continental AG. Transmittal, reproduction, dissemination and/or editing of this document as well as utilisation of its contents and communication thereof to others without
expressed authorisation are prohibited. Offenders will be held liable for payment of damages. All rights created by patent grant or registration of a utility model or design patent are reserved.
TQDR, Engine torque status
multiplied by the number of mis?ring cylinders (obtained from the sum of bits given by NC_FID_TQI_MIS).
In the case of no mis?re the torque error from mis?re is therefore automatically zero.
NC_FID_TQI_FSD_xx is an array indicating which engine cylinder banks have FSD (fuel system) errors. The
calibration constant represents the torque error due to an error on a single cylinder bank. The total torque
error is therefore this calibration constant multiplied by the number of errors (obtained from the sum of
bits given by NC_FID_TQI_FSD_xx). In the case of no FSD errors the torque error is therefore automatically
zero.

belongs to FRF_LAW. This de?nition provides a dimensionless number that is not engine speci?c, and provides

� General Information
This module provides the possibility to implement project speci?c Torque model ef?ciency corrections.
The output EFF_TQI_COR_CUS is utilized in the calculation of the actual torque and the ignition angle set-
point.
The output EFF_TQI_COR_CUS_BAS is a input parameter for the calculation of EFF_TOT_BAS_SLOW and effects
the torque setpoint TQI_SP_MAF for the slow air path.
In addition, this module provides the factor for ignition ef?ciency correction FAC_EFF_IGA as output which is
an input for calculation of EFF_IGA_AV. This factor is calculated based on STATE_CH.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST, Deactivation
Activation: LV_ST_END
Deactivation: if activation not true
Recurrence: 10MS

� General Information
Different combustion modes may have different ef?ciencies from a torque perspective. In order to have an
accurate engine torque, it is therefore necessary to correct the torque model based on the current combustion
mode.
In this module a mapping between the combustion mode and the torque model corrections is performed.
The mapping is performed both for the current and for the target combustion mode.
There may be many combustion modes de?ned (e.g. 30), but not all of these are relevant for the torque model.
Additionally the same corrections can be used for several different combustion modes (e.g. OPP2, OPP3). A
limited number of torque model corrections are de?ned (e.g. 3) and a many to one mapping is performed
between combustion modes and torque model corrections. This mapping is calibrated via the label array. For
each combustion mode the corresponding torque model index is chosen. This index is used for all correction
array maps in TQDR, and is also exported for use in other aggregates (e.g. IGSP).

TQDR, Combustion mode ef?ciency
Figure 70.31.1: Combustion mode mapping to torque model
For ramping to a new target combustion mode and to ensure combustion mode switching without torque
jump, the ef?ciency of the target combustion mode is calculated. These values are shown with the extension
_TAR. The slow path setpoints can be faded between the current mode and the target mode, the faded values
have the extension _BAS.

70.31.3.4 Target mode combustion mode ef?ciency
As long as transition between current and target mode is active (LV_TRAN_CMB_ACT=1) target ef?ciency is

In case LV_TRAN_CMB_ACT is 0 both ef?ciencies are equal to EFF_TQI_CMB.

TQDR, Combustion mode target torque
� General Information
Combustion mode switching should normally take place without any torque jump, therefore the combustion
mode manager (CBMD) requires a feedback from the torque model. This feedback is provided via a hold ?ag,
LV_TQ_TRAN_CMB_MOD_HLD. Whilst this ?ag is 1, a switch without torque jump is not possible. This means
that the current combustion mode should be held. Elsewhere in TQDR, via fading factors etc, the slow path
is ramped to the set point for the new combustion mode. Eventually a torque jump free switch becomes
possible, the hold ?ag is set to 0, and the combustion mode switch can take place.
The hold ?ag is calculated via a comparison of the required spark ef?ciency for producing the current actual
engine torque in the target combustion mode with the calculated maximum and minimum possible spark
ef?ciencies in the target mode.
The minimum and maximum ef?ciency in the target combustion mode are calculated using the reference,
basic and minimum ignition angle (difference) for the target mode. These values are output from IGSP.
If the required spark ef?ciency lies within this minimum and maximum then a switch without torque jump is
possible and the hold ?ag is set to 0.
It is also possible to calibrate offsets to the minimum and maximum ef?ciency e.g. to ensure that the spark
angle is not hard against IGA_MIN in the new combustion mode.
� Application Conditions
Initialisation: RST
Activation: always
Deactivation: if activation not true
Recurrence: 10MS

ef?ciency.

a) Determination of Breakpoints 
The selection of the breakpoints for the 
measurement series is crucial for the 
accuracy of the torque model. However, it 
is not necessary to achieve the same level 
of accuracy for the whole operating range 
of the engine. Instead, the aim should be 
to get the highest accuracy in operating 
ranges where model deviations are 
perceptible the most, e.g., at idling or in 
the transition region between different 
Valve Lifts. Consequently, the 
measurement grid has to be adapted to 
these requirements. It is clear that these 
crucial operating ranges differ from engine 
model to engine model, and thus, no 
universal measurement grid can be given. 
 
The breakpoint specifications below 
provide a concept for the definition of a 
measurement matrix for the engine of 
interest. Depending on the project phase, 
the matrix can be reduced for speeding up 
the calibration process. 
 
N : N_IS - 200 rpm, N_IS, N_IS + 200 
rpm, 1000 rpm ... N_MAX ( ?N = 500rpm) 
MAF : MAF idle , 100mg/stk  ... MAF_MAX 
(?MAF = 50mg/stk) (measurement range 
will depend on VVL position) 
IGA : IGA MBT  ... IGA_MIN (4 
breakpoints) 
LAMB: 0.85 
VVL: High and Low (2 discrete 
breakpoints) 
CAM_IN: Min..Max (3 breakpoints) 
CAM_EX: Min..Max (3 breakpoints) 
 
b) Measurement Procedure 
It is recommended to conduct the 
measurements in the following manner: 
- Set VVL position 
- Set IVVT position (CAM_IN, CAM_EX) 
- Set engine speed operating point (N - 
control of engine dyno) 
- Set MAF operating point 
(C_TPS_SP_MAN) 
- Perform IGA - Swing 
(C_IGA_HOM_MAN) 
- Apply Fuel Cut-Off (C_TI_AS_GLOB) 
- Next MAF operating point 
- Next engine speed operating point

- Next IVVT position 
- Next VVL position 
The acquisition of the measurement data 
should be started after the operating point 
has been stabilized for more than 180 
seconds. To gain sufficient statistical 
confidence, data should be acquired for 
approximately 20 seconds with a sampling 
rate of at least 5 Hz. 
On a daily basis, the current performance 
characteristics of the engine should be 
documented by a measurement at a 
reference point (recommended: 2000rpm, 
2bar Imep). Appropriate measures have to 
be taken if the operating parameters of 
the engine deviate from the reference 
values. 
 
 
c) Numerical Optimization 
The tool ?Interactive Control Development 
and Parameterization? (ICDP, delivered in 
SPT package) will be used for the 
numerical optimization of the 
measurement data and the 
parameterization of the model. 
After the selection of the database for the 
basic optimization, the user will be guided 
through the optimization process by the 
user interface of the ICDP-tool. Here 
some recommendations for the 
optimization/parameterization: 
- The overall goal for the optimization / 
parameterization process is an absolute 
model accuracy of 5Nm. So the first focus 
should be to reach this accuracy without 
paying too much attention to smoothness 
and monotony of the maps. After the 
requirements on accuracy have been met, 
the weights for smoothness and monotony 
can be gradually increased. 
- In most cases, overly steep slopes, 
holes, peaks etc.  do not represent actual 
physical relationships, and thus, are not 
acceptable in the maps. They are often 
the result of interpolations / extrapolations, 
and are not supported by actual 
measurement data. If an irregularity like 
that is detected, the tool enables the user 
to manually change these points. After a 
manual adjustment, the model accuracy

Basis for the optimization are engine dyno 
measurement data that were acquired for 
all relevant combinations of Cam shaft 
positions and Valve lift positions. The 
measurement data are grouped in k*i*j 
data sets 
  
Tq_Mdl_Meas_Data_(1...k)(1..i)(1..j).csv  
 
 i - number of Cam_IN position variations,

It is advisable to fill the map 
IP_IGA_REF_COR_IVVT_VVL with the 
values of reference ignition angle for each 
data set, while the map 
IP_IGA_REF_SEL[k] 1 with zeros. 
The map IP_TQI_REF is used for 
determination of maximum torque at 
clutch. Therefore, IP_TQI_REF should be 
filled with the values from the map 
IP_TQI_REF_VVL_CAM[k][i][j] having 
maximum values at high loads. 
IP_MAF_SP is obtained by an inversion of 
IP_TQI_REF (e.g. in the SPT tool 
MapTool). 
IP_EFF_IGA is used for determination of 
multiple injection mode. This map has to 
be calibrated with respect to the 
requirements for multiple injection (refer to 
module 5009 'Combustion state 
manager').

a) Determination of Breakpoints 
To reduce the measurement and calibration 
effort, the separate set of torque 
measurements has to be performed for the 
determination of Lambda efficiency. The 
measurement matrix can be reduced as 
follows.  
 
N : N_IS, 1000 rpm ... N_MAX ( ?N = 
1000rpm) 
MAF : MAF idle , 100mg/stk  ... MAF_MAX 
(?MAF = 100mg/stk) (measurement range will 
depend on VVL position) 
IGA : IGA MBT  ... IGA_MIN (4 breakpoints) 
LAMB: LAMB_COP, 0.85, 1.0 ( ?=0.85 at all 
operating points, other ? only at relevant load 
points) 
VVL: High and Low (2 discrete breakpoints) 
CAM_IN: Setpoint - position 
CAM_EX: Setpoint - position 
 
b) Measurement Procedure 
It is recommended to conduct the 
measurements in the following manner: 
- Set VVL position 
- Set IVVT Setpoint - position 
- Set engine speed operating point (N - control 
of engine dyno) 
- Set MAF operating point (C_TPS_SP_MAN) 
- Set Lambda operating point   
 (C_MFF_HOM_MAN) 
- Perform IGA - Swing (C_IGA_HOM_MAN) 
- Next Lambda operating point 
- Apply Fuel Cut-Off (C_TI_AS_GLOB) 
- Next MAF operating point 
- Next engine speed operating point 
- Next VVL position 
 
c) Numerical Optimization 
In this optimization stage, the impact of 
Lambda-variations on torque model 
parameters will be evaluated and 
implemented. The ICDP tool will be used for 
the numerical optimization of the 
measurement data and the parameterization 
of the model. In the ICDP-tool, the user has to 
select the function ?Lambda indicated torque?.

Authorization for single cylinder fuel cut-off 
 
 
During normal operation, the Cylinder fuel cut-
off is authorized by the requests defined in 
"Dynamic torque request coordination". The 
following switches serve for test purposes 
only: 
LC_TQ_SCC_ENA_MAN = 0 
Permanent manual authorization of SCC. 
LC_INH_FCUT_FAST = 0 
By default, intervention from LV_FCUT_FAST 
is allowed. This logical variable contains 
requests for SCC that are independent from 
dynamic torque manager states (e.g. for 
preventing engine speed overshoot at 
gearshift) 
LC_TQ_SCC_INH_MAN = 0 
Manual inhibition of authorization from 
dynamic torque request coordination and/or 
dynamic torque intervention manager. 
C_N_MIN_AUTH_PAT_TQ_LIM = 0 
Minimum engine speed for authorization of 
torque based pattern during torque request for 
safety limitiation 
C_N_SP_IS_OFS_AUTH_PAT_TQ_LIM = 0 
Offset on IS Setpoint for authorization of 
torque based pattern during torque request for 
safety limitiation 
 
 
 
 
Determination of scaling factor 
 
 
With the calibration constants 
LC_ENA_xxx_TOT, it can be defined whether 
Fuel cut-off is performed immediatly or  after a 
certain efficiency defined by 
C_FAC_IGA_MIN_TEG_IGA_BAS has been 
passed.  
LC_ENA_FCUT_FAST_TOT = 1 
Immediate Fuel cut-off is authorized if fuel cut-
off is triggered with LV_FCUT_FAST_TOT. 
Since the fuel cut-off is performed at 
EFF_IGA_BAS_COR, ignition intervention is 
not possible. 
LV_FCUT_FAST_TOT contains the 
coordinated requests for bypassing dynamic 
torque manager authorization. 
LC_ENA_TQ_SCC_REQ_TOT = 1 
Immediate Fuel cut-off is authorized if fuel cut-

be 0...1) 
This constant scales the range between 
EFF_IGA_BAS_COR and 
EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG(_LGRD), in which fuel 
cut-off is not authorized. If the constant is set 
to Zero, fuel cut-off will be performed after 
EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG has been reached. If it is 
set to 1,  SCC intervention is performed 
instantly after a request has been detected. 
This way the required behavior can be 
adjusted: either with regard to a exhaust gas 
temperature or with regard to emissions. 
 
 
 
 
Rate limitations for negative gradients of 
EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG  
 
In order to avoid high frequent jumps between 
pattern and spark retarding, a rate limitation is 
applied to EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG, resulting in 
the output EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG_LGRD. 
The following values are generic 
recommendations. Adjustements have to be 
done in the vehicle.

Two application labels allow to manipulate the 
efficiency setpoint (LC_EFF_SCC_SP_MAN 
and C_EFF_SCC_SP_MAN). Depending on 
the efficiency setpoint a pattern is calculated.

of the pattern index NR_PAT_SCC is done by 
applying a hysteresis C_EFF_SCC_SP_HYS

NC_CYC_ADD_ACT 
Default: 
C_EFF_SCC_BAS_MAN = 1 
LC_ENA_EFF_SCC_BAS_MAN = 0 
C_EFF_SCC_BAS_MAN is a manual calibration 
value for EFF_SCC_BAS that is enabled by the 
logical switch LC_ENA_EFF_SCC_BAS_MAN. 
EFF_SCC_BAS has a direct impact on the 
calculation of the MAF setpoint for 
homogeneous mode. 
 
LC_EFF_SCC_AV_MOD_SEL=0: 
The value EFF_SCC_AV is calculated as the 
number of opened injectors at the last two or 
four revolutions  divided by the number of 
cylinders NC_CYL_NR or twice NC_CYL_NR. 
The input value PREV_STATE_IV (word) 
defines the status of each injector during the last 
finished injection cycle. If a cylinder-allocated bit 
of PREV_STATE_IV is active, the injection was 
performed for the respective cylinder. 
The injection information in PREV_STATE_IV is 
used to calculate a vertical sum. This sum is 
stored in SUM_PREV_STATE_IV. The value 
SUM_PREV_STATE_IV_OLD is the stored 
vertical sum from the segment n-1. With 
NC_CYC_ADD_ACT set to 1, the efficiency is 
calculated as average value over two 
combustion cycles. 
  
 LC_EFF_SCC_AV_MOD_SEL=1: 
The value EFF_SCC_AV is calculated as ratio 
between the number of injected cylinders for the 
next injection cycle  (NC_CYL_NR - 
SUM_INH_INJ)  and the total number of cylinders 
NC_CYL_NR. The value SUM_INH_INJ is 
calculated in the module ?Cylinder Shut-off? and 
represents the number of deactivated injectors 
for the following injection cycle.  
 
Default: 0 
This non-calibratable constant determines if 
EFF_SCC_AV is calculated based on the 
injection information of one working cycle or as 
average over two working cycles.

C_FAC_TQE  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
C_CRLC_TQI_AV_HOM 
Default : 0.025 
This constant represents the mass moment of 
intertia of the rotating engine parts multiplied by 
Pi/30. 
It is used in the following manner to calculate the 
effective torque: 
TQE_DIF = C_FAC_TQE * N_GRD 
 
By solving this equation for C_FAC_TQE, the 
following relationship is obtained: 
 
C_FAC_TQE = TQE_DIF/N_GRD 
 
This relationship can be used to calibrate this 
constant: 
Engage the clutch (MT) or put the transmission 
in Neutral (AT) 
Record N_GRD and TQ_AV while the engine 
load is increased by means of a step input 
(C_TQI_SP_MAN (careful!) or PV_AV) 
C_FAC_TQE is found as the mean slope in the 
graph TQ_AV vs. N_GRD 
 
Default : 1 
Filter constant for calculation of TQI_AV_HOM 
1: belongs to Aggregate IGSP but will be calibrated together with remaining torque model parameters
2: belongs to Aggregate VVTI but will be calibrated together with remaining torque model parameters
3: belongs to Aggregate TQLO but will be calibrated together with remaining torque model parameters

TQDR, Torque operating range (gen)
IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL[k]  
IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
The output of the map 
IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL represents the 
minimum torque request with regard to 
combustion stability. The map has to be 
calibrated for all relevant VVL positions versus 
engine speed N_32 and coolant temperature 
TCO. It is recommended to select the 
breakpoints according to these guidelines (the 
same breakpoints will be used for 
IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU): 
TCO: Minimum temperature ... steady-
state operating temperature (~90�C)  (4 points) 
N_32:  N_SP_IS ... N_MAX (12 
breakpoints) 
The minimum temperature for TCO at each 
engine speed setting depends on the 
capabilities of the engine dyno cooling system.  
At each N_32/TCO/Valve Lift operating point, 
the calibration values can be obtained by this 
procedure: 
1. Fill the maps IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL 
and IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU with passive values 
(= 0 Nm). 
2. Adjust a light load setting via the torque 
structure (i.e. PV_AV). The torque request 
TQ_REQ_CLU should be a little bit more than 0 
Nm. 
3. TQI_REQ_SLOW and TQI_REQ_FAST 
should have the same value. Copy this value 
into the map IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL. In 
order to avoid inaccuracies due to interpolation, 
it is recommended to fill the entire map with that 
value. 
4. Now, set the active torque request to 0 
(PV_AV = 0, TQI_REQ_xxx = 0, IGA = 
IGA_MIN). 
5. Lower the map entries in 
IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL until signs of a 
deteriorating combustion can be observed 
(COV IMEP , HC emissions). 
6. Keep the map values in 
IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL constant and 
adjust IP_TQI_MIN_REQ_PU.  Start with a 
value TQI_MIN_REQ_PU so that EFF_IGA_SP 
= EFF_IGA_MIN. Then, raise the value 
gradually until the temperatures of the exhaust 
gas and the exhaust gas aftertreatment system 
reach values that are safe for a stationary 
operation. This condition should usually be met 
if EFF_IGA_SP >= EFF_IGA_MIN_TEG. 
7. Depending on the project preferences, fine

tune both maps to find either the minimum 
possible torque or the minimum possible engine 
load (MAF/MAP) within the given constraints. 
E.g. an increase in TQI_MIN_REQ_PU might 
allow a reduction of TQI_MIN_PU. 
8. If necessary, perform a fine tuning of the 
operating point parameters (i.e. TCO) and wait 
for steady-state conditions. Store the values for 
TQI_MIN_PU and TQI_MIN_REQ_PU, and 
proceed to the next operating point. 
Since the cylinder wall temperature at a given 
Coolant temperature TCO will be higher at 
steady-state operating conditions than during 
engine warm up, cold start tests have to be 
conducted next. 
1. In a Cold room/Climate chamber, condition 
the engine to a minimum temperature. 
2. Start the engine and adjust an N_32/VVL 
operating point on the dyno. During the 
following warm up period, raise the values in the 
map IP_TQI_MIN_PU_CBK_VVL to ensure a 
smooth engine operation. Raise the values for 
TQI_MIN_REQ_PU either proportionally or 
leave them as they are (Exhaust gas 
temperature is not of concern yet). 
3. Repeat for other N_32/VVL operating 
points. Avoid N_32/VVL/TCO combinations that 
are harmful to the engine.

get stuck at higher rpm's.  For the calibration of

In a Altidude chamber or on a Uphill-Drive, 
investigate the engine tip-in/let-off behavior in
